item.title: Lawmakers Warn Senate Health Care Bill Could Worsen Opioid Crisis
item.description:
June 28, 2017 - Some senators are concerned about how the Senate Republicans health care bill would affect treatment for opioid addiction.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/28/534765000/lawmakers-warn-senate-health-care-bill-could-worsen-opioid-crisis
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: 55 Percent Of Americans Disapprove Of Senate Health Care Bill
item.description: June 28, 2017 - A new NPR-PBS NewsHour-Marist poll shows President Trump's approval ratings below 40 percent and approval of the GOP health care proposal in the teens. This toxic environment makes it even tougher for Republicans to forge a deal to meet their twin goals of repealing the Affordable Care Act and making affordable care more accessible.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - A new NPR-PBS NewsHour-Marist poll shows President Trump's approval ratings below 40 percent and approval of the GOP health care proposal in the teens. This toxic environment makes it even tougher for Republicans to forge a deal to meet their twin goals of repealing the Affordable Care Act and making affordable care more accessible. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/28/534764993/55-percent-of-americans-disapprove-of-senate-health-care-bill

item.title: Proposed Medicaid Cuts Likely To Put Pressure On Nursing Homes
item.description: June 28, 2017 - Two thirds of nursing home residents are paid for by Medicaid. Proposed cuts could put pressure on nursing homes and the older adults they serve.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - Two thirds of nursing home residents are paid for by Medicaid. Proposed cuts could put pressure on nursing homes and the older adults they serve. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/28/534764940/proposed-medicaid-cuts-likely-to-put-pressure-on-nursing-homes

item.title: Boston Surgeon Argues Senate GOP Bill Threatens Nation's Health
item.description: June 28, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Atul Gawande, a surgeon at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston and a staff writer for The New Yorker, about what the health care industry learned from the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Atul Gawande, a surgeon at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston and a staff writer for The New Yorker, about what the health care industry learned from the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/28/534764933/boston-surgeon-argues-senate-gop-bill-threatens-nations-health

item.title: U.S. Air Pollution Still Kills Thousands Every Year, Study Concludes
item.description: June 28, 2017 - An analysis examining mortality among millions of Americans concludes that a tiny decrease in levels of soot could save about 12,000 lives each year.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - An analysis examining mortality among millions of Americans concludes that a tiny decrease in levels of soot could save about 12,000 lives each year. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/28/534594373/u-s-air-pollution-still-kills-thousands-every-year-study-concludes

item.title: Mutant Strains Of Polio Vaccine Now Cause More Paralysis Than Wild Polio
item.description: June 28, 2017 - So far this year, there have been only six cases of wild polio — and 21 cases of vaccine-derived polio, most of them in Syria.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - So far this year, there have been only six cases of wild polio — and 21 cases of vaccine-derived polio, most of them in Syria. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/28/534403083/mutant-strains-of-polio-vaccine-now-cause-more-paralysis-than-wild-polio

item.title: The Battle Over American Health Care: What's At Stake In The Senate's Bill
item.description: June 28, 2017 - Vox.com correspondent Sarah Kliff says Republicans determined to replace and repeal Obamacare are finding it's "awfully difficult to write a bill that would get rid of it entirely."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - Vox.com correspondent Sarah Kliff says Republicans determined to replace and repeal Obamacare are finding it's "awfully difficult to write a bill that would get rid of it entirely." http://www.npr.org/2017/06/28/534709887/the-battle-over-american-health-care-whats-at-stake-in-the-senates-bill

item.title: Hospital Official Waits To See When Senate Votes On GOP Health Bill
item.description: June 28, 2017 - The vote has been postponed until after the July 4 holiday. Steve Inskeep talks to Dr. Rod Hochman, CEO of Providence St. Joseph Health, which has hospitals in seven states including Washington.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - The vote has been postponed until after the July 4 holiday. item.title: This GOP Health Bill Proposes New Limits To Medical Malpractice Awards
item.description: June 28, 2017 - The bill H.R. 1215 would limit awards for non-economic damages — such as pain and suffering — to $250,000. President Trump supports the bill, but many others across the political spectrum don't.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Just 17 Percent Of Americans Approve Of Republican Senate Health Care Bill
item.description: June 28, 2017 - In a new NPR/PBS NewsHour/Marist poll, 55 percent of Americans say they disapprove of the Senate GOP bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 28, 2017 - In a new NPR/PBS NewsHour/Marist poll, 55 percent of Americans say they disapprove of the Senate GOP bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/28/534612954/just-17-percent-of-americans-approve-of-republican-senate-health-care-bill

item.title: Q&A: What Does The Senate Health Bill Mean For Me?
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The Senate Republicans' plan to overhaul the Affordable Care Act could bring big changes to many Americans' health care coverage. Here are answers to a handful of scenarios from concerned listeners.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The Senate Republicans' plan to overhaul the Affordable Care Act could bring big changes to many Americans' health care coverage. Here are answers to a handful of scenarios from concerned listeners. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/27/534576392/q-a-what-does-the-senate-health-bill-mean-for-me

item.title: Senate GOP Leaders Postpone Health Care Vote Until After July 4th
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Senate Republican leaders are delaying a vote on their bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, with many senators left to convince.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Senate Republican leaders are delaying a vote on their bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, with many senators left to convince. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534597188/senate-gop-leaders-postpone-health-care-vote-until-after-july-4th

item.title: Kaiser Foundation CEO Grapples With Potential Impact Of Senate GOP Health Care Bill
item.description: June 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Drew Altman, president and CEO of the Kaiser Family Foundation, about his reactions to the Senate GOP health care bill and why health care in America is so expensive.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Drew Altman, president and CEO of the Kaiser Family Foundation, about his reactions to the Senate GOP health care bill and why health care in America is so expensive. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534597143/kaiser-ceo-grapples-with-potential-impact-of-senate-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: Senate Republican Leaders Delay Vote On Health Care Bill
item.description: June 27, 2017 - President Trump huddled with Republican senators on Tuesday to discuss the Senate's health care bill. Republican leaders decided to delay a vote on the measure amid concern it doesn't have enough support to pass.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - President Trump huddled with Republican senators on Tuesday to discuss the Senate's health care bill. Republican leaders decided to delay a vote on the measure amid concern it doesn't have enough support to pass. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534597136/senate-republican-leaders-delay-vote-on-health-care-bill

item.title: Considering Breast-Feeding? This Guide Can Help
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The vast majority of pregnant women in the U.S. say they plan to breast-feed, but aren't told that many new moms worldwide find it tricky. Being mentored the first weeks after birth can help a lot.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The vast majority of pregnant women in the U.S. say they plan to breast-feed, but aren't told that many new moms worldwide find it tricky. Being mentored the first weeks after birth can help a lot. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/27/534123212/considering-breast-feeding-here-s-how-to-make-it-easier
